answers.answer: Hi Chris,I apologize for my delay in responding.You do have many symptoms of diabetes and a strong family history, so looking into this is a must.  A fasting blood sugar usually will be adequate, especially if you are having all these symptoms, to diagnose diabetes, but it is not perfect. You have a few other options:1)ask your doctor to schedule an oral glucose tolerance test. You will have a fasting level drawn, drink a glucose-load, then have your glucose checked again. This is the second accepted way to diagnose diabetes.A Hemoglobin A1C is also used, but is not widely accepted as a good way to screen for diabetes. If it is 7%  ofcourse, then you have diabetes.2)You can buy a meter and start checking you blood sugar on your own.I strongly suggest doing either or both of these soon to find out what is going on. If you do not have diabetes, then your doctor should look for other reasons why you feel so poorly(thyroid tests etc).Take care
